Reaction¶

class CRUMPET.Reaction(database, rtype, name, data, coeffs=None, bg=None, species=None, isotope='H', mass=1, Tarr=0, fcf=1)¶

Bases: object

Class containing reaction data

This class contains data pertaining to a single defined reaction, such as energy transfer rates, reactants, products, and reaction rates.

…

name¶

reaction handle/ID

Type

string

database¶

database where reaction rates are defined

Type

string

rate(Te, Ti, ne=None, E=None, omegaj=1)¶

returns the temperature- and density-dependent reaction rate coefficients Te : float

electron temperature in eV

Tifloat

ion temperature in eV

nefloat, optional (default: None)

electron temperature in m**-3, only used for type=’UE’

Efloat, optional (default: None)

molecular energy in eV, only used for type=’RATE’

omegajfloat, optional (default: 1)

statistical weight for ADAS reaction rates

Type

function

type¶

identifier for the kind of reaction being defined: ‘RATE’ : EIRENE-type interpolation in one or two dimensions,

depending on the shape of coeffs

‘COEFFICIENT’ : Spontaneous transition rate, s**-1 ‘ADAS’ : ADAS-type interpolation ‘SIGMA’ : Sawada 1995-type cross-section fit ‘APID’ : APID-type ionization rate ‘UE’ : UEDGE-type interpolation

Type

string

reactants¶

a list of the reactant species handles

Type

list of strings

products¶

a list of the fragment species handles

Type

list of strings

Vp¶

the total potential of the products

Type

float

Vr¶

the total potential of the reactants

Type

float

K¶

the kinetic energy transferred to the procucts in the reaction: if a species is born in the reaction, they are assigned the local temperature of that species, which is evaluated upon calls to getS

Type

float/string

Kdep¶

marker determining wheter K is dependent on the species temperature, i.e. whether a new species is born

Type

boolean

S_V(*args)¶

Returns the change in potential for the reaction calculated from the potential of the reactions and products

Type

function

S_e(Te, *args)¶

Returns the electron energy increase for the reaction. Only relevant for ionization reactions. Te is the electron temperature in eV

Type

function

S_g(*args)¶

Returns the gamma energy for the reaction calculated from the potential difference between the reactants and products. Only nonzero if the reaction is radiative decay

Type

function

S_r(Te, Ti, Tm)¶

Returns the background reactant energy loss, calculated from the net energy balance

Type

function

Smat¶

Smat has len=8 along axis=0 and len=2 along axis=1. The first 4 entries along axis=0 are: reactant energy loss, potential energy change, radiated energy in atomic lines, and radiated energy in molecular lines, all for electron-impact processes. The next 4 entries are the corresponding energy terms but for proton-impact processes. The first entries along axis=1 are the internal terms and the second due to external sinks and sources (currently 0)

Type

2D list

Tarr¶

A vector containing the electron temperature points of ADAS fits only relevant for ADAS rates, otherwise not used

Type

ndarray

absorption¶

marker determining if the reaction is an electron-absorption reaction

Type

boolean

coeffs¶

the reaction rate coefficients. The shape and values depend on the type of reaction. Used by rate() to calculate the reaction rates

Type

ndarray

decay¶

marker whether the reaction is non-radiative decay, e.g. decay from an unstable state into dissociation products

Type

boolean

radrelax¶

marker whether the reaction is radiative relaxation

Type

boolean

prode¶

marker whether an electron is created in the reaction, i.e. the reaction does not conserve electron energy

Type

boolean

e¶

marker whether the reaction is an electron-impact reaction or not

Type

boolean

p¶

marker whether the reaction is and proton-impact reaction or not

Type

boolean

p_mult¶

list of fragment mutipliers, same length as products

Type

int

e_mult¶

list of product mutipliers, same length as products

Type

int

getS(Te, Ti, Tm, E, marker=False)¶

Evaluates Smat at given Te, Ti, Tm, and E

Parameters

  • Te (float) – electron temperature in eV

  • Ti (float) – ion temperature in eV

  • Tm (float) – molecular temperature in eV

  • E (float) – assumed molecular rest energy in eV

Returns

Evaluated ndarray of Smat

Return type

ndarray

parseS(data, bg, species, isotope)¶

Derives the reaction information

Assigns the majority of the object attributes, including the energy sinks/sources for the different components

Parameters

  • r (list of strings) – reactant handles

  • p (list of strings) – fragment handles

  • K (string) – string of kinetic energy information

  • bg (dict) – Crm.bg, dict of background species and potentials

  • species (dict) – Crm.species, dict of CRM species and potentials

Returns

Return type

None

pick_rate()¶

Initialization of the rate attribute

print_reaction()¶

Returns formatted a string with the reaction

ret0(*args)¶

Zero-function

__init__(database, rtype, name, data, coeffs=None, bg=None, species=None, isotope='H', mass=1, Tarr=0, fcf=1)¶
Parameters

  • name (string) – reaction handle/ID

  • database (string) – database where reaction rates are defined

  • rtype (string) – database fit type according to EIRENE definitions

  • coeffs (ndarray) – the reaction rate coefficients. The shape and values depend on the type of reaction. Used by rate() to calculate the reaction rates

  • type (string) –

    identifier for the kind of reaction being defined: ‘RATE’ : EIRENE-type interpolation in one or two dimensions,

    depending on the shape of coeffs

    ’COEFFICIENT’ : Spontaneous transition rate, s**-1 ‘ADAS’ : ADAS-type interpolation ‘SIGMA’ : Sawada 1995-type cross-section fit ‘APID’ : APID-type ionization rate ‘UE’ : UEDGE-type interpolation

  • S (dict) –

    dict containing the reaction information, requiring the following keys: ‘reactants’ : list of strings

    reactant handles

    ’products’list of strings

    fragment handles

    ’K’string

    string of kinetic energy information

  • bg (dict) – Crm.bg, dict of background species and potentials

  • species (dict) – Crm.species, dict of CRM species and potentials

  • Tarr (list, optional (default: 0)) – Array of ADAS temperature point. Only used when typ=ADAS

  • isotope (string) – The handle for the isotope being used. Used to identify atomic and molecular species

  • mass (float) – The isotope mass in AMU, used for calculations in Crm

rate¶

print(‘==============’) print(self.database, self.type, self.name) print(self.coeffs) print(self.rate(1,1,ne=1e12,E=0.1)) print(self.rate(10,10,ne=1e13,E=1))

  • K (string) – string of kinetic energy information

  • bg (dict) – Crm.bg, dict of background species and potentials

  • species (dict) – Crm.species, dict of CRM species and potentials

Returns

  • Ti (float) – ion temperature in eV

  • Tm (float) – molecular temperature in eV

Sr(Te=0, Ti=0, Tm=0)¶

Temperature-dependent reactant sink try:

ret = self.Vr - self.Vp - eval(self.K)

except:

ret = self.Vr - self.Vp - self.K

return ret

decaySr(Te=0, Ti=0, Tm=0)¶

Temperature-dependent fragmentation # TODO: IS SIGN MISMATCH WARRANTED??! try:

ret = -eval(self.K)

except:

ret = self.K

return ret
